sites.name: Pöstlingberg
sites.description: Iconic mountain with a basilica offering panoramic views of Linz. Reached by the steep Pöstlingbergbahn, one of the steepest adhesion railways in the world.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Winter can be snowy but scenic.
sites.booking_tips: No reservation needed for the mountain, just buy train tickets.

sites.name: Ars Electronica Center
sites.description: Interactive museum exploring the intersection of art, technology, and society. Known as the 'Museum of the Future' with cutting-edge exhibits.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with rotating special exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Book Deep Space 8K shows in advance. Consider combination tickets.

sites.name: Lentos Kunstmuseum
sites.description: Modern art museum in a striking glass building on the Danube riverfront. Houses an impressive collection of modern and contemporary art.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with temporary exhibitions changing periodically.
sites.booking_tips: Combined ticket with Nordico Museum available. Check for guided tours.

sites.name: Linz Castle (Schlossmuseum)
sites.description: Historic castle housing Linz's provincial museum with collections including medieval art, historical artifacts, and natural history exhibits.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Castle grounds particularly pleasant in summer.
sites.booking_tips: Check for combination tickets for multiple museums in Linz.

sites.name: Hauptplatz (Main Square)
sites.description: Central historic square and heart of Linz's old town, featuring the impressive Holy Trinity Column (Pestsäule) and colorful baroque buildings.
sites.seasonal_notes: Hosts Christmas markets in December and various events throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Many cafés and restaurants available on the square.

sites.name: Mariendom (New Cathedral)
sites.description: Neo-Gothic cathedral and largest church in Austria, known for its beautiful stained glass windows and impressive spire. Can hold up to 20,000 people.
sites.seasonal_notes: Respect service times when visiting. Special Christmas and Easter services.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed for general visiting. Check for tower access times.

sites.name: Danube Park
sites.description: Large riverside park perfect for relaxation, walking, and cycling along the Danube. Features modern public art and recreational facilities.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most enjoyable in warm weather. Winter months can be cold but still accessible.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Rentable bikes available nearby.

sites.name: OK Contemporary Art Center
sites.description: Forward-thinking contemporary art space featuring rotating exhibitions of experimental and avant-garde art.
sites.seasonal_notes: Exhibitions change regularly. Check current program online.
sites.booking_tips: No reservation typically needed. Special events may require booking.

sites.name: voestalpine Stahlwelt
sites.description: Interactive exhibition about steel production at voestalpine, one of Austria's largest industrial companies. Shows the history and future of steelmaking.
sites.booking_tips: Book plant tours in advance, as they have limited availability.

sites.name: Botanical Gardens
sites.description: Extensive botanical gardens with over 10,000 plant species, including themed areas like the Japanese garden and tropical greenhouses.
sites.seasonal_notes: Different plants bloom seasonally. Greenhouses open year-round.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Check for guided tours or special exhibitions.

sites.name: Alter Dom (Old Cathedral)
sites.description: Baroque Jesuit church where Anton Bruckner worked as an organist. Features the famous Bruckner Organ and beautiful baroque interior.
sites.booking_tips: Check for organ concerts which often showcase Bruckner's compositions.

sites.name: Höhenrausch
sites.description: Temporary art project on the rooftops of Linz's old town, combining contemporary art installations with stunning views of the city.
sites.seasonal_notes: Only open during summer months (usually May to October).
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed but check if the installation is running during your visit.

sites.name: MURAL Harbor
sites.description: Europe's largest gallery of graffiti and mural art along the industrial harbor area of Linz, featuring over 300 murals by international artists.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best viewed in good weather. Boat tours mostly operate April-October.
sites.booking_tips: Book guided walking or boat tours in advance. Self-guided visits always possible.

sites.name: Nordico Stadtmuseum
sites.description: Museum documenting the history and urban development of Linz from Roman times to the present day, with changing exhibitions.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with rotating temporary exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Combined ticket with Lentos available. Check for guided tours.

sites.name: Linzer Landstraße
sites.description: Main shopping street in Linz, offering a mix of international brands, local shops, cafes, and department stores in a pedestrianized zone.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most lively during standard shopping hours. Special decorations during Christmas season.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Many restaurants and cafes along the street.

sites.name: Linz Südbahnhofmarkt
sites.description: Vibrant farmers' market near the South Train Station offering fresh local produce, regional specialties, and international foods.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open Tuesday to Saturday, with best selection in the morning. Seasonal produce varies.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Try coming early for the freshest selection.

sites.name: Stifterhaus
sites.description: Cultural institution and museum dedicated to the famous Austrian writer Adalbert Stifter, housed in his former residence.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with consistent opening hours.
sites.booking_tips: Small museum with limited capacity. Check for special literary events.

sites.name: Brucknerhaus
sites.description: Modern concert hall on the Danube, named after composer Anton Bruckner. Major venue for classical music and the annual Bruckner Festival.
sites.seasonal_notes: Bruckner Festival held in September. Check performance calendar for events.
sites.booking_tips: Book concert tickets in advance, especially for Bruckner Festival performances.

sites.name: St. Martin's Church
sites.description: One of the oldest preserved churches in Austria, dating back to the Carolingian period with parts from the 8th century.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check opening hours as they may be limited. Respect service times.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed for general visiting.
